bill_title: allow school districts to offer elementary grade levels only.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow school districts to offer elementary grade levels only. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-5-1 be amended to read as follows: 13-5-1. Any territory organized for the express purpose of operating not less than a thirteen-year six-year school program and governed by an elected school board is defined to be a school district. It may sue and be sued, contract and be contracted with, purchase, hold, and use personal and real property for school purposes, and sell and dispose of the same property . Section 2. That § 13-5-35 be amended to read as follows: 13-5-35. No school district may be formed after July 1, 1998, unless it operates both an elementary and a secondary school within the boundaries of the district. No existing or newly- formed school district need operate a secondary school but shall, at a minimum, operate an elementary school that serves students in kindergarten to grade five, inclusive. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
